channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road has subsided, dangerous, 25th July
item.description:
The road has been subsiding for a while, I reported this before and was told it was not a problem but has now got significant worse. could cause damage to tires and car if lower down
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Appledore Crescent, Longlands, London

item.title: Grass verge still uncut despite keep reporting, 25th July
item.description:
The grass verge on the corner of Blythe Hill and |Breakspears Drive remains uncut. It is disgracefully unkept with weeks feet high. You said that you would investigate and have closed it and you have done nothing about it. PLEASE will you cut this grass and tend these spaces. This year has been the worst year for upkeep of this area. It has been cut just once after weeks and grass had reached several feet high and I repeatedly had to report it. I do not wish to be rude but we pay you to upkeep these areas. It is a health hazard as dogs foul in the area. There are foxes so there could be ticks there. This is outside people homes and its a scruffy disgraceful mess. It is attracting even more rubbish being dumped there as mess attracts more mess. Its DISGRACEFUL!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blythe Hill, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Needs maintaining, 25th July
item.description:
It’s blocking view when crossing and needs to be trimmed. It’s a big area as a lot is hanging over. On Roman way - not the same as the one coming from bucknall way (the private road part)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Park, London

item.title: Sign blocked again, 25th July

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wickham Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: To whom it concerns I would like to report this ongoing issue of anti-social behaviour and public orders taking place at this location Friday and weekends are at its worst Caribbean black males hanging around near off-licence and street corner in large groups drinking alcohol smoking drugs drug dealing all hours.Residents in surrounding properties and rented accommodations feel unsafe and insecure with these grown men drunk male men and taking drugs small children live in the surrounding area.., 25th July
item.description:
Public orders anti-social behavior taking place at this location. Drug users alcoholic drug dealers. Hanging around all hours Friday night until week end local off-licence offers late night liquor to alcoholic drinking on street corners enlarge groups.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bradstock Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 114 + 116 Greenwood Road council flats, 25th July
item.description:
Constant littering from these flats, overflowing bins, rubbish all over pavement every week! They need to take responsibility for their own rubbish + stop dumping junk on the pavement, the only messy tennants on the street! Sort it out!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwood Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Left road works barriers, 25th July
item.description:
For nearly 1 year these red and white barriers have been left here. They have not been picked up. It was for the duration of work being performed here to protect workers but this is nearly 1 year ago now.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattresses, fridge, wardrobe, 25th July
item.description:
The rubbish outside this house has been piling up for months. It’s unsightly and of course the fridge is a serious safety concern when it comes go children. There is a primary school at the top of out road. I don’t know who lives there - if anyone.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Hearns Road, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Abandoned car, 25th July

item.title: Trees outside 49 to 35 Buckland Crescent, 25th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Buckland Crescent, Belsize Park, London
